# Christian B. Martinez — Portfolio Overview

## Who I Am
* Christian B. Martinez, full-stack web developer based in Utah.
* Technical Co-Founder at Pointbreak (2025—present); previously freelance (2020—2024) and Front End Developer at MMBC (2017—2020).
* Experienced in building polished SaaS products, developer tooling, and AI-assisted workflows.

## What I Do
* Design and code modern Next.js applications with high accessibility and performance standards.
* Lead product engineering, developer experience, and UI systems for startups and technical teams.
* Write in-depth blog posts about React 19, Next.js 16, caching strategies, and modern frontend tooling.

## Tech Stack & Tools
* Frameworks: Next.js 16 App Router, React 19.2, TypeScript 5.9.
* Styling: Tailwind CSS v4 tokens, custom oklch theme, Bright for code blocks.
* Tooling: Bun runtime, ESLint (core-web-vitals, tailwindcss, simple-import-sort), Prettier with Tailwind plugin, Vercel Analytics & Speed Insights.
* Other specialties: Cache Components, Partial Pre-Rendering, React Compiler, Vercel deployment workflows.

## Featured Projects
* Cli Loaders — a suite of animated loaders for terminals, React apps, and other runtimes (cliloaders.com).
* Chattr — customizable ChatGPT-style chatbot components for Next.js (github.com/cbmongithub/chattr).
* Additional experiments and OSS live throughout the GitHub profile (`cbmongithub`).

## Site Structure
* `/` — Portfolio landing page with hero intro, featured projects, work history, blog, and contact section.
* `/blog` — Article index (currently React 19 RCE guide + “What’s New in Next.js 16: A Deep Dive”).
* `/blog/[slug]` — Individual posts rendered as typed TSX files with Bright-powered code samples.
* Supporting routes: `robots.ts`, `sitemap.ts`, and dynamic OG image generation under `/api/og`.

## How to Reach Me
* GitHub: https://github.com/cbmongithub
* Twitter/X: https://twitter.com/cbmonx
* LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/cbmonlinkedn

## Quick Facts
* Uses Tailwind-aware design tokens stored in `src/styles/globals.css` for cohesive light/dark themes.
* Portfolio content, blog posts, and metadata are written in TypeScript/TSX—no CMS required.
* Tests, linting, formatting, and production builds run via Bun scripts (`bun run build:verify` for the full pipeline).
